Title: Adventure Golf - Haigh Hall
Description: 18 holes featuring exciting challenges and obstacles. Take a ride on the viking boat, challenge yourself to the oak tree stump vortex hole and simply indulge in the stunning views making this an adventure golf course like no other.

Title: Alexandra Park
Description: The fifteen acres on which Alexandra Park is laid out, were given by Colonel Hollinshead Blundell. The park was opened by Colonel Blundell in April 1903. When the Colonel died three years later a monument to him was erected in the park. Amenities included two…

Title: Alexandra Park Skatepark
Description: Wigan Borough currently boasts two top skateparks in Ince (at Walmsely Park) and Newtown (at Alexandra Park, close to the ATS garage and Currys/McDonalds) which feature a mini-ramp, a Wembley gap, flatbank, quarter-pipes, jumpbox, stepped grind-box, grind boxes, a driveway, hipped flatbank, and a hipped…

Title: Amberswood
Description: Amberswood and Low Hall were created as a result of mining, but today are areas rich in wildlife and ready to be explored. Amberswood is a 160 hectare nature reserve at the heart of Greenheart. The area consists of a series of small lakes, ponds,…
Location: Moss Lane, Platt Bridge, WIGAN, WN2 3TQ

Title: Ashfield Park
Description: With large areas of green spaces and some stunning scenery, the Borough of Wigan is perfect for taking country walks and rambles or for discovering beautiful woodland, lakes and canals. There is lots to see and do in Wigan's Parks and Countryside during the different…
Location: Ashfield Park Drive, Standish, WIGAN, WN6 0EQ, 01942 486999

Title: Ashton Park Skatepark (Jubilee Park)
Schedule: No time restrictions, outdoor public facility
Description: Wigan Borough currently boasts three top skateparks in Ince (at Walmsely Park), Ashton (Jubilee park) and Newtown (at Alexandra Park, close to the ATS garage and Currys/McDonalds) which feature a mini-ramp, a Wembley gap, flatbank, quarter-pipes, jumpbox, stepped grind-box, grind boxes, a driveway, hipped flatbank,…

Title: Astley Street Park
Description: Astley Street Park is a beautiful and well kept small park with facilities including: playing fields, children's play area, bowling greens, football pitches and pavilion.

Title: Beacon Country Park
Description: Beacon Country Park is West Lancashire District Council's main countryside site, consisting of over 300 acres of rolling countryside on the slopes of Ashurst Beacon which forms a backdrop to the town of Skelmersdale. There is space to walk, run, ride horses or bicycles, fly…
Location: Beacon Lane, Upholland, WIGAN, LANCASHIRE, WN8 7RU

Title: Billinge Plantation
Description: This is one of over 1,000 woods across the UK cared for by the Woodland Trust. Billinge Plantation is 23 acre isolated patch of mature broadleaved woodland planted in the late 19th century, and is a prominent sky line feature. The site contains 3 formal…

Title: Borsdane Wood and Rayner Park Friends Group
Description: We are an established community group of volunteers who care about these local green spaces. We have twice weekly work parties that monitor the woods, remove litter, report damage or issues, remove invasive plants, plant trees, and other duties under the supervision of Wigan Council.…

Title: Borsdane Wood Local Nature Reserve (LNR)
Description: Borsdane Wood is Wigan's first Local Nature Reserve filled with wildlife, flowers and trees are all protected so people can enjoy them all year round. There is a footpath running the whole length with benches to sit on and simply take it all in at…
Location: At the end of Hindley Mill Lane, Hindley, WIGAN, WN2 4BT

Title: Colliers Wood
Description: Over 30 years ago this wood was an active coal mine with vast spoil heaps bordering the local houses. The 130 hectare woodland has since been dramatically landscaped to create open spaces, wildflower meadows and great views across the borough to Winter Hill, Astley Green…

Title: Crawford's Wood
Description: This is one of over 1,000 woods across the UK cared for by the Woodland Trust. Crawfords wood occupies 49.5 acres of land and on the west side of the village of Aspull and the site is mostly flat. Crawford's wood trees was planted in…

Title: Crazy Golf - Haigh Hall
Description: The course is open between Easter and October - 11am to 4pm weekends during term time, and daily during school holidays. A round of Crazy Golf costs £1 per player. Please visit the website provided to find out more.

Title: Firs Park
Description: Firs Park was developed from wastelands in 1921. The land and park were a gift to the local community from Sir John Holden of Tunnicliffe and Hampson, owners of the Firs Mills. The 15 acre park has retains its original layout. Features include an outdoor…

Title: FootGolf - Haigh Hall
Description: FootGolf blends two of our most popular sports and adds in a dash of fun. No plus fours are needed, no studded boots or shinpads. Simply follow the rules of golf and let your feet do the talking. If you can kick a ball you…

Title: Friends of Standish Recreation Ground
Description: The Friends of Standish Recreation Ground are a voluntary group set up to help protect and care for the recreation ground on Southlands Avenue, Standish, known locally as "The Rec".  The aims of the group include: Helping maintain and improve the Rec, Encouraging the use…

Title: Friends of Stockley Park
Description: The Friends of Stockley Park are a small volunteer group who are passionate about looking after our local park. We work in partnership with Wigan Council to maintain and enhance our park, and continue to develop it to meet the needs of the community. Our…

Title: Go Ape
Description: High up in this open, spacious site, our Treetop Challenge offers the perfect blend of blood-pumping action and beautiful country views. With 13-metre-high platforms and a brilliant free-falling Tarzan Swing, this is the only Go Ape location in the UK to feature a zip wire…
Location: Great House Barn, Rivington Lane, Horwich, Bolton

Title: Haigh Hall and Country Park
Description: Facilities include: Haigh Hall Venue Nature trails and Woodlands Craft Gallery which holds craft classes Playground for children of all ages Crazy Golf Adventure Activities are available for groups through the Wardens Conservation Task Days Haigh Hall Golf Complex Haigh High Ropes Kitchen Courtyard Open…

Title: High Ropes - Haigh Hall
Description: Haigh High Ropes is the north west's favourite aerial adventure for all the family. Start with our low ropes course to get your head for heights and then try the high ropes challenge which will test even the biggest daredevil in the family. The courses…

Title: Jubilee Park
Description: Jubilee Park on the way to Ashton is one of the most beautiful and well kept small parks in the borough. Facilities include a pavilion and toilets, tennis and basket ball courts, grass pitches play areas, woodland area and a formal flower park.

Title: Kirkless Wood
Description: Kirkless Wood lies to the north west of the village of Pennington Green near Wigan, Greater Manchester. The site was acquired and planted by the Woodland Trust in 1997. The woodland extends existing secondary woodland known as Woodshaw Ruck, which is owned by Wigan Metropolitan…

Title: Lady Mabel's Wood
Description: This is one of over 1,000 woods across the UK cared for by the Woodland Trust. Lady Mabel's Wood is a 65 acre woodland close to the centre of Wigan and next to Haigh Hall Country Park. The site came into Woodland Trust ownership in…

Title: Leyland Park
Description: The Leyland Park is a beautiful and well kept small park with facilities including playing fields, playground, bandstand, tennis courts and football pitches.

Title: Lilford Park
Description: Lilford Park was originally created in 1885 on 9 acres of land, in later years this was extended to over 51 acres. The extension included a large area of Bedford Wood and additional fields. The park includes a play area for all children aged 12…

Title: Low Hall Park Nature Reserve
Description: Low Hall (LNR) is located right next to Amberswood and, although smaller, is also a very important link in the Wigan Borough wildlife corridor. It has a mixture of woodland and wetland and is rich in wildlife and habitats. The area is a haven for…

Title: Orrell Water Park
Description: A nature reserve and coarse fishery, Orrell Water Park is open all-year round for residents, visitors and day ticket fishing. Beautiful woodland surrounds two disused reservoirs and is home to a diverse group of birds and insects, with over 100 bird species and a wide…

Title: Pennington Flash Country Park
Description: Pennington Flashes (LNR) is part of an impressive country park. The lake and surrounding marshland are home to a diverse group of mammals, birds and insects, including 5 RSPB red listed birds and the protected water vole. The main nature reserve features a number of…
Location: Off St. Helens Road, LEIGH, WN7 3PA

Title: Pennington Hall Park
Description: A pretty community park with play areas, tennis courts, bowling greens and a band stand. Events take place in the park throughout the year, including a popular Last Night of the Proms event in September.

Title: Scotsman's Flash
Description: Scotmans Flash Activity Centre is located just outside Wigan town centre. Learn a wide range of water sports or take your skills to the next level.   Scotmans Flash Activity Centre is now under the management of Wigan Council.  Here you can take part in a…

Title: Sensory Rooms
Description: Embrace have two sensory rooms at Platt Bridge Community Zone, Platt Bridge, Wigan. Our sensory rooms provide specialised equipment to support relaxation and stimulation in a quiet safe space. Space Room Explore darkness, stars and lights in our space room – includes relaxation bed, star…
Location: Platt Bridge Community Zone, 81 Ribble Road, Platt Bridge, Wigan, WN2 5EG, 01942 233323

Title: Three Sisters Local Nature Reserve (LNR)
Description: The Three Sisters (LNR) is a wildlife wetland reserve providing the local community and visitors a gateway into the wider Wigan Flashes Nature reserve. Extensive surrounding footpaths are a haven for walkers, cyclists and horse riders. Picnic and play areas can be found on site together…
Location: Three Sisters Road, Bryn, Ashton-in-Makerfield, WIGAN, WN4 8DD

Title: Viridor wood
Description: From Colliery to community woodland, with large open spaces, great views, sculptures and car parking Viridor Wood is an ideal way to spend an afternoon. Linking to the Three Sisters Country Park and the Leeds and Liverpool Canal you can explore further afield from here.…
Location: Bolton Road, Bryn Gate,, Ashton-in-Makerfield, WIGAN, WN4 8TJ

Title: Walmsley Park
Description: Walmsley Park has:  Area woodland and wetlands habitats    Extreme sports skate park which feature a mini-ramp, a Wembley gap, flatbank, quarter-pipes, jumpbox, stepped grind-box, grind boxes, a driveway, hipped flatbank, and a hipped quarter-pipe.   A children’s play area.

Title: Wigan Flashes
Description: Wigan Flashes (LNR) is a highlight of any visit to Greenheart. The area offers its surrounding communities countryside on their doorstep, enabling residents and visitors to enjoy rich wildlife and diverse habitats within easy reach of Wigan’s town centre. Title: Wigan Flashes Conservation and Community Group
Description: Wigan Flashes Nature Reserve is part of  the Flashes of Wigan and Leigh National Nature Reserve.  Our group works closely with Lancashire Wildlife Trust to help maintain and improve Wigan Flashes Nature Reserve for both wildlife and the public. We help with events to promote…

Title: Worthington Lakes Country Park
Schedule: Open every day of the year
Description: Worthington Lakes lie within the Douglas Valley between Wigan to the south and Chorley to the north, with road access off the A5106. It is owned and managed by United Utilities. Picnic area, car parking, and wheelchair friendly footpaths (some paths are suited for assisted…
